title: Augusta County: John Hamilton Ervine to Ellen Ervine, June 18, 1861
summary: In this letter to his wife Ellen, Ervine describes the route followed by his regiment when marching in Virginia. He talks about civilians' kind treatment of the soldiers and describes a battle in which a few Confederate soldiers held off a large force while on a bridge. The letter also touches on the value of horses in his company and on the friends he has seen while in the service.
keywords: African Americans, Battle Description, Camp Life, Family, Home Front Troop Movement, Women, American Civil War
